intro: Sabatia dodecandra, commonly known as the twelve-angled ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, showcasing its adaptability to humid environments. Its leaves are opposite and often have a rough texture, while its stems are rigid and covered in fine hairs. Sabatia dodecandra is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
